title: How to Delete the Cache in YouTube: Desktop & Mobile App

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This method clears the app’s cache data, resetting the YouTube app. This fixes common issues, but it doesn’t reset your recommendations since that information is stored on your YouTube account. [1] X Research source Note that the steps will vary depending on your version of Android and your device model. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . This will open the list of apps.

steps.title: Tap YouTube.
steps.content: Tap YouTube . This will open the app options for YouTube.

steps.title: Tap Storage.
steps.content: Tap Storage . This will open the storage settings for the YouTube app.

steps.title: Tap Clear cache.
steps.content: Tap Clear cache . This will clear the YouTube app’s cache data, which will fix minor issues with the app. If there’s still a problem with the app, try deleting the app and reinstalling it.

steps.title: Locate the YouTube app on your homescreen.
steps.content: Locate the YouTube app on your homescreen. To clear the app cache, you’ll need to delete the app from your phone and redownload it. Clearing the cache will help fix minor issues with the app, but it won’t reset your recommendations, since that data is stored on your YouTube account. Alternatively, you can locate YouTube in the App Library.

steps.title: Tap and hold the YouTube app.
steps.content: Tap and hold the YouTube app. This will make an options menu appear.

steps.title: Tap Remove App.
steps.content: Tap Remove App . This will open a prompt asking how you want to remove the app.

steps.title: Tap Delete App.
steps.content: Tap Delete App . This will delete the YouTube app and its data from your phone. After it finishes deleting, redownload the app from the App Store. Doing so will restore your YouTube data, but removes any cached data that may have been corrupted, which caused the app not to work properly.

steps.title: Click the More button in Chrome.
steps.content: Click the More button in Chrome. It’s the three vertical circles in the top right of chrome, next to your profile picture. This method clears your Google Chrome cache, fixing minor issues with the YouTube website. This won’t reset your recommendations, since that data is stored on your YouTube account. [3] X Research source Open Google Chrome if it isn't already opened. This method covers Google Chrome. For Firefox, Microsoft Edge, and Safari, check out our general guide to clearing your browser’s cache .

steps.title: Click More tools.
steps.content: Click More tools . This is in the More pop up menu.

steps.title: Click Clear browsing data.
steps.content: Click Clear browsing data . This is an option in the “More tools” section of the More menu.

steps.title: Select a time range and deletion options.
steps.content: Select a time range and deletion options. Selecting “All time” in the Time range drop down box is the most surefire way to resolve issues. To clear the cache, you only need to check the “Cached images and files” option. Clearing the “Cookies and other site data” may also help resolve problems.

steps.title: Click Clear data.
steps.content: Click Clear data . This will confirm your choices and delete the selected data for the select time frame.

steps.title: Click the profile button in your browser at https://www.youtube.com/.
steps.content: Click the profile button in your browser at https://www.youtube.com/ . It’s the circle with your profile picture in the top-left of https://www.youtube.com/ . This opens the YouTube profile options. If you’ve been watching YouTube videos , but the recommendations haven’t been good lately, deleting your watch and search history resets the recommendations, giving you a fresh start.

steps.title: Click Your data in YouTube.
steps.content: Click Your data in YouTube . It’s next to the shield icon with a person inside. This is in the profile options.

steps.title: Click Manage your YouTube Watch History.
steps.content: Click Manage your YouTube Watch History . It’s at the bottom of the YouTube Watch History section.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . This will open an options menu to select a range of history to delete.

steps.title: Click Delete all time.
steps.content: Click Delete all time . This will open a confirmation window.

steps.title: Click Delete.
steps.content: Click Delete . This will confirm the deletion of your watch history and search history. Doing so will essentially reset your YouTube recommendations, since it won’t be able to use your history to recommend content.

steps.title: Tap the profile button.
steps.content: Tap the profile button. Your profile picture is in the lower right corner of the app. Use this method to delete the watch history on YouTube with the YouTube app on Android and iPhone.

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . This gear icon is in the top right corner of your screen and opens the Settings menu.

steps.title: Tap Manage all history.
steps.content: Tap Manage all history . This will open your history menu.

steps.title: From the "Delete" drop-down, select Delete all time.
steps.content: From the "Delete" drop-down, select Delete all time . This brings up thumbnails of all the videos that you've watched recently to make sure that you want to delete it all.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . Find this button in the lower right corner. Tapping it will delete all your watch history on YouTube.
